intro: Meryta malietoa, commonly known as the Kauri tree, is a large evergreen tree native to the tropical regions of the Pacific Islands. It belongs to the family Araliaceae and is characterized by its tall, straight trunk and broad, palmate leaves. The plant is known for its slow growth and can reach heights of up to 30 meters in favorable conditions. Its bark is thick and fibrous, providing structural support and protection against environmental stressors. Meryta malietoa plays a significant ecological role in its native habitats, offering habitat and food for various native species.
